instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3209 Intermittent Ram 3 Beep
threads.message:
THis Mac works good sometimes, intermittently won't boot and beeps 3X. I tried flux and heat on ram chips @ 200C. they are all getting 1.365V. 

Flex cable on this mac is sketchy but I'm guessing there can't be any relevance to the ram voltage or connection? Have a new flex coming soon for it I didn't have any spare for this specific model.

Can you reFLOW ram chips?

threads.title: 820-3209 Intermittent Ram 3 Beep
threads.message:
Reflow is not a solution.
Sometime can work, but you should tap on top of each chip when balls get melted.

I did reball all 16 chips on 3023 board and it still works after months.
But I'm not so sure if I'll accept to do that again for a client.

threads.title: 820-3209 Intermittent Ram 3 Beep
threads.message: THis is mine to refurbish/sell if viable. so can do normal 400C temp to ram chips w/o damaging? I'm thinking this must be intermittent connection... seems to run fine if it boots but there must be something when it does initial check on startup that isn't always producing properly

threads.title: 820-3209 Intermittent Ram 3 Beep
threads.message: Must've tapped one too hard. No boot/fan spin. Its going in the parts bin. RIP

threads.title: 820-3209 Intermittent Ram 3 Beep
threads.message: What about a reballing to revive it?
